description: Flaws in authentication mechanisms (e.g., weak passwords, session management) allow unauthorized access to accounts or resources.
evidence: Directory listing enabled on web server, exposing sensitive files in the '/uploads' directory.

description: Program attempts to write data beyond the boundaries of a fixed-length buffer, potentially leading to code execution.
evidence: Unencrypted credit card numbers found in database table 'payments'.

description: Untrusted user input is passed to a system shell without proper validation, allowing arbitrary commands to be executed.
evidence: Crash report generated when sending 1000 bytes of 'A' characters to the application's input field.

description: Misconfigured or missing security controls, such as default passwords or unnecessary services, create vulnerabilities.
evidence: Default credentials 'admin:admin' successfully used to login to the admin panel.

description: An application exposes a reference to an internal implementation object, such as a file or database key, without proper authorization checks.
evidence: Reflected XSS detected in parameter 'name' on page /search.php. Payload: <script>alert('XSS')</script>

description: Untrusted user input is passed to a system shell without proper validation, allowing arbitrary commands to be executed.
evidence: Directory listing enabled on web server, exposing sensitive files in the '/uploads' directory.

description: An attacker can execute arbitrary code on a remote system due to a flaw in the application.
evidence: Direct access to user profiles allowed by manipulating the 'user_id' parameter in the URL.

description: Unsanitized user input allows injection of malicious scripts into a web page.
